question: What is the difference between a process and a thread, and how does context switching differ between them?
answer: Process: separate memory space, heavier context switch. Thread: shared memory, lighter context switch.
diagram:
flowchart TD
  A[CPU Running] --> B{Context Switch}
  B -->|Process| C[Save Full Memory Space]
  B -->|Thread| D[Save Registers Only]
  C --> E[Load New Process Memory]
  D --> F[Load New Thread Registers]
  E --> G[Resume Process]
  F --> H[Resume Thread]
